meanings.definition: To coat with a layer of silver again.
meanings.sent1: She resilvers her favorite necklace to make it shiny once more.
meanings.sent2: The silversmith resilvers antique silverware to bring back its original luster.
meanings.sent3: After a mishap with the cleaning solution, she quickly resilvers the tarnished tray.
meanings.sent4: The moonlight gently resilvers the calm surface of the lake.
meanings.sent5: The skilled artisan carefully resilvers the intricate design on the mirror.

meanings.definition: To restore or renew a silver coating.
meanings.sent1: He resilvers the old picture frame to give it a fresh look.
meanings.sent2: The restoration expert resilvers the vintage mirror to preserve its beauty.
meanings.sent3: In a creative DIY project, she resilvers her worn-out jewelry to make it sparkle again.
meanings.sent4: The laughter of children seems to resilver the memories of the elderly woman.
meanings.sent5: The rain gently resilvers the leaves of the trees, creating a magical shimmer.

meanings.definition: The act of applying a new layer of silver to an object.
meanings.sent1: The resilvers of antique items require precision and expertise.
meanings.sent2: She admires the intricate details of the resilvers on the jewelry display.
meanings.sent3: The art exhibit showcases various beautiful resilvers on historical artifacts.
meanings.sent4: The resilvers on the crown add a touch of elegance to the royal collection.
meanings.sent5: The museum curator carefully examines the resilvers on the ancient artifacts for authenticity.
